result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Alexander Rohde

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Alexander Rohde in court.  Attorney Paige Aleece Styler in court for Brandon Alexander Rohde.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

As to Count 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Brandon Alexander Rohde in court.  Attorney Amanda M. Parent appeared by video for Brandon Alexander Rohde.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
A plea hearing for entry into DPA has not been completed as of today's date. Parties requested a plea hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Brandon Alexander Rohde in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court to address bail conditions concern. Court modified bail conditions to no dangerous weapons EXCEPT FOR a baton for use during his employment.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.  
As a condition of bail, apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Brandon Alexander Rohde in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire & Addendum to the Plea Questionnaire
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 7/11/22 @ 2:45p
